result.name: nematode-assemblages-from-the-chronically-trawlled-silver-pit-in-the-central-north-sea-nov-2001
result.notes:
Data consists of presense data of nematode worms in the form of count data. 
Meiofauna samples were collected with aNIOZ corer in November 2000 and April 
2001, from three study areas in the Silver Pit, central North Sea, that were 
subject to different levels of fishing effort. 

The CSV file 'nematode_assemblages' contains the counts of nematode and 
harpacticoid copepods from each sample. The CSV file 'abiotic_factors' 
contains infromation on the level of trawling disturbance at each of the 
sites, as well as sediment granulomety data.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Nematode assemblages from the chronically trawlled Silver Pit in the central North Sea, November 2000-April 2001

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
resources.name: Cefas Data Portal
